Articles.Content:
I love building and designing stupid things that require cheats to be useful. Like a rocket sled, which work amazingly well with infinite fuel on, or a rocket seat SSTO provided with everything a Kerbal could need and able to do everything by itself.

I also feel obligated to put probe cores on EVERY ship I make. Just in case something happens to the crew.

And I cheat. A lot. To build gigantic bases on several planets.

I love digging through blogs like "Vintage Space", "False Steps", "Beyond Apollo", "Eyes Turned Skyward", etc, for ideas about spacecraft and missions that were never followed through on, or were attempted and failed. Then I see if I can work around the problems and make things work (in a sandbox, we don't need no steenking budget!). I'm running a very successful N1/LOK/LK programme, and plan to tackle Mir 2 after learning the pitfalls of building Mir 1. Blue Gemini is coming along nicely, as well.

I'm also big on verisimilitude. The closer I can get my work to look as it would in the real world, the better.

I just can't stop putting SRBs in all my rockets.

My space station on an asteroid has four BACCs. Empty, launched empty too. SRBs make for some very good structural elements ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Nice lander! Does it have an ISRU unit?

Yes I'm onto next-generation craft now. They all (mostly) have ISRU units on board along with anything else you might need to explore the Kerbol system. I have no need for space stations or mining bases or transports, I can do everything quicker and easier with my fleet of starships. I'll still build a few bases/stations but I like to keep then total number of active flights on my save games less than 20 - and with that number I could have infrastructure all over the Kerbol system. Then I would just need to build a ship that can go as far as Minmus and it will be able to go anywhere after that. So I'm free to design whatever I want.

JR
